para.text: The following elements are available in a collaboration diagram.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: And click at the position where Object will be placed in the

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Then quick dialog is shown. At the quick dialog, enter the object name.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

para.text: Procedure for creating outgoing from object stimulus by using shortcut creation syntax
In order to create outgoing stimulus from selected object to another object,

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Double-click from-object, or select from-object and press
key to pop up quick dialog.
At the quick dialog, enter stimulus name after "->" string ("<-" string for incoming and "<->" for outgoing with return).

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: key and outgoing stimulus from selected object to target object is created and placed at the last order.

para.text: In order to set class to active object,

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;
li.text: If class property is not assigned, you can't change object to active object.

para.text: Procedure for setting to multi object
In order to set object to multi object,

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Set object's IsMultiInstance property to true.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Then the object is assigned as multi object.

para.text: Procedure for creating object from class
In order to create object from class,

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Then the object(instance of the class) is created.

para.text: Procedure for creating class from object
If class is not assigned to object,

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Double-click object to pop up quick dialog. Then quick dialog is opened.
At the quick dialog, click add class button.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Then new class is created and assigned to object.

para.text: If you want existing class to be assigned to object, enter the existing class name at the
Procedure for adding AttributeLink to object
There are two way to add attribute link to Object.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: using object model in the main diagram or the

li.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;

para.text: In the case of using object model,

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: popup menu, and you can add Attribute Link.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Then new attribute link is created.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: popup menu of object or click

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: , you can add attribute link by using

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Drag from one Object and drop to the other Object in the

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Between two objects, the link is created.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: And click the object that self-link will connect to in the

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: And click the self-link that the stimulus will be placed in the

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: And double-click the stimulus, enter the stimulus name at the quick dialog.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Click the link that the stimulus will be placed in the

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: And double-click the stimulus, enter the stimulus name at the quick dialog.

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

para.text: Procedure for changing ActionKind of stimulus
property of stimulus should be assigned to one of five sort as following. To change
property, select stimulus and select the

table.style: width:38%; cell-padding:1px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#aca899; border-style:solid; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: And click at the position where Frame will be placed in the

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

para.text: Procedure for showing sequence numbers in the diagram
In order to show or hide stimulus sequence number, select the diagram in the
property of diagram to true or false.
Procedure for changing signature style of message in the diagram
There are four message style. To change stimulus signature,

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;
text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;
li.text: property of diagram to one of the followings.

table.style: width:100%; cell-padding:1px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#aca899; border-style:solid; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: shows message name and arguement name
shows message name, arguement type, and return type
shows message name, arguement name, arguement type, and return type
